questions.clue: This American Founding Father once disguised himself as a humble farmer to gather intelligence on British troop movements during the Revolutionary War.
During the French Revolution, this queen reportedly disguised herself as a maid in an attempt to escape Paris.
To escape from Crete, this legendary Greek king disguised himself as a peasant herder.
In 1651, after losing the Battle of Worcester, this English king famously disguised himself as a woodcutter's son to flee to France.
This Russian empress disguised herself as a man to ride among her troops and rally support for her coup against her husband, Peter III.
This kitchen appliance uses a magnetron to heat your food by exciting water molecules.
The filament in an incandescent light bulb is typically made of this element, known for its high melting point.
This type of battery, commonly used in portable electronics, utilizes lithium ions moving between electrodes.
On non-stick pans, this polymer, known by the trade name Teflon, prevents food from sticking.
This common material, made by heating limestone and clay, forms the basis of concrete when mixed with water.
This Danish author's tale of a mermaid who sacrifices everything for love was first published in 1837.
Originally written in Spanish, 'One Hundred Years of Solitude' is a masterpiece by this Colombian author.
Translated from Russian, 'War and Peace' features the lives of members of the Russian aristocracy during the Napoleonic era.
The novel 'The Name of the Rose', set in a 14th-century Italian monastery, was originally written in this language.
Translated from Chinese, 'Dream of the Red Chamber' is one of China's Four Great Classical Novels, written by this author.
This composer created the iconic score for 'Star Wars,' featuring the famous 'Imperial March.'
Hans Zimmer composed the soundtrack for this 2010 sci-fi thriller directed by Christopher Nolan.
The 1994 Disney animated classic featuring songs by Elton John and Tim Rice is this film.
This 1984 film's soundtrack includes the song 'Ghostbusters,' performed by Ray Parker Jr.
Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross won an Oscar for scoring this 2010 film about the creation of Facebook.
This ancient wonder is the only one still standing and is located in Giza, Egypt.
Completed in 1931, this New York skyscraper held the title of world's tallest building for nearly 40 years.
Known for its intricate carvings, this temple complex in Cambodia was originally dedicated to the Hindu god Vishnu.
Located in Agra, India, this white marble mausoleum was commissioned by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife.
This complex, designed by Antoni Gaudí, is a still-unfinished basilica in Barcelona with a unique blend of Gothic and Art Nouveau styles.

final.clue: Published in 1818, this novel's full title includes 'The Modern Prometheus' and was written by an author who was only 18 at the time.
